indications:
Indications type 2 diabetes mellitus (as monotherapy or in combination with metformin
when metformin alone inadequate)
name: REPAGLINIDE
cautions:
Cautions substitute insulin during intercurrent
illness (such as myocardial infarction, coma, infection,
and trauma) and during surgery (omit repaglinide on morning of surgery
and recommence when eating and drinking normally); debilitated
and malnourished patients; interactions: Appendix 1 (antidiabetics)
side-effects:
Side-effects abdominal pain, diarrhoea, constipation, nausea,
vomiting; rarely hypoglycaemia, hypersensitivity
reactions including pruritus, rashes, vasculitis, urticaria, and visual
disturbances
doses:
adult over 18 years, initially
500 micrograms within 30 minutes before main meals (1 mg if transferring
from another oral hypoglycaemic), adjusted according to response at
intervals of 1–2 weeks; up to 4 mg may be given as a single dose,
max. 16 mg daily; elderly over 75 years,
not recommended
